title: Cyber Security Compliance - Intern
description:
**Position Title: Cyber Security Compliance - Intern**


**Location: Dallas, TX**


**Your role:** This role as a summer intern will collaborate with diverse teams within Cyber Resilience (CRaaS) supporting areas such as Cyber Security Operations, Assurance and Compliance. Digital Realty’s Cyber Resilience Team is the front line for all things pertaining to our company’s digital security posture. Cyber Security Compliance Intern role involves conducting audits, security assessments and assisting with risk management reviews and third-party assessments. This opportunity will provide great exposure about Cybersecurity governance, technologies, and functions. This intern will also gain valuable experience assisting our global security and risk management programs.


**What you’ll do**


* Participate on a variety of engagements in analyzing, consulting, and reporting associated with Cyber assurance and compliance requirements.
* Assist in reviews and enhancement of security policies that aligns with global regulations and leading practices.
* Track enterprise compliance across multiple security frameworks including SOC 2, NIST and ISO and maintain up-to-date records of requirements and corresponding mitigating controls.
* Monitor third-party risk assessments and assist in performing internal risk assessments.
* Analyze management and technical controls to ensure that specific security and compliance requirements are met through the verification of documented processes, procedures, and standards in order to validate maintenance of secure configurations.
* Participates in cross organizational working groups representing cyber compliance initiatives.
* Assist in mapping Digital Realty requirements and regulatory requirements across the information security framework to identify overlapping requirements and compliance efficiencies.
* Assists in sharing key examination findings to help organizations limit security risks and comply with laws relating to securing customer financial and sensitive data.
* Assists in global cyber security audits, internal and external.
* Participate in the development of security and privacy awareness training in conjunction with other members of the Security Compliance group.
* Collaborate on critical IT projects to ensure that security policy/risk issues are addressed throughout the project life cycle.


**What you’ll need**


* Pursuing master’s or bachelor’s degree in cyber security, Engineering, Risk Management, or a related field from a 4-year accredited university, preferably
* Strong understanding of technologies, network operations and Data Center Ops.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
* Familiar with GRC tools such as, ServiceNow is highly preferable, but not mandate.
* Curiosity/Preparing for Cyber Security Certifications (CISM/CISSP/GIAC etc.)
* Basic knowledge about SOC2, ISO27001, NIST 800-53a, NIST 800-171, FedRAMP, SOX


**A bit about us**



Digital Realty brings companies and data together by delivering the full spectrum of data center, colocation, and interconnection solutions. PlatformDIGITAL®, the company’s global data center platform, provides customers with a secure data meeting place and a proven Pervasive Datacenter Architecture (PDx®) solution methodology for powering innovation and efficiently managing Data Gravity challenges. Digital Realty gives its customers access to the connected data communities that matter to them with a global data center footprint of 300+ facilities in 50+ metros across 25+ countries on six continents.

  


**Notes:**



The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.



Digital Realty is an equal opportunity employer, EOE/AA/M/F/Vets/Disabled. All applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, or other status protected by law or Company policy.



Digital Realty is a publicly traded company (NYSE: DLR) with investment grade ratings from all three major ratings agencies.



Please do not forward unsolicited resumes to any employee of Digital Realty and its subsidiaries. Digital Realty is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited referrals.

title: Summer Intern- IT Security
description:
Overview : PRG is the world’s leading provider of services and solutions in entertainment and live events. Every day, we turn the creative vision of our customers into production and technical reality, deepening their connection to their audiences. What sets us apart are our people. No other company in our industry has such a deep and diverse bench of talent, working across theatre, TV, film, music, corporate events, equipment rental and more. With over 250 patents and registered trademarks, PRG is defined by innovation. And through our network of 38 offices spanning five continents, we can deliver for our customers anywhere around the globe. Responsibilities:

Paid Internships at Production Resource Group are educational work experiences for individuals who wish to explore a career with PRG and/or develop hands-on knowledge and skill in the business of entertainment technology. PRG provides structured yet flexible programs where interns rotate through the various functions of a particular discipline, giving them a comprehensive overview of the different aspects of the field.  

The internship program is 12 weeks. The Summer Program runs approximately \*Mid to late May- Beg/Mid-August (\*dates may vary)  

Each **IT Security Intern** will:* Gain Project, task management, communication, and documentation skills
* Learn Security Incident Response processes including preparation, identification, containment, eradication, and recovery.
* Assist with management of security events/alerts raised by the security event tools. Ensure assigned security events/incidents are mitigated by their SLA.
* Work directly with SOC team to eradicate security findings, and gain experience working within a SIEM.
* Work closely with internal teams to resolve security findings on endpoint systems, infrastructure, and web applications.
* Participate in the creation and delivery of Information Security Awareness, Training, and Education program materials.
* Assist with phishing simulation & response.
* Assist with conducting risk assessments, security audits, vulnerability/penetration tests with commercial tools and techniques.
* Carry out research on information security and privacy issues and keeps abreast of the latest technology, industry best practices, and hardening standards to address security exposures and threats.
* Assisting with the PRG data classification project, will work with various departments to understand PRG data and processes.
* Support the goals of the security team by working on key initiatives as needed.


Qualifications:

We are looking for applicants who are/have:* Passion for gaining experience with Information Security and Risk Management.
* Have a deep interest in pursuing a career in security or risk including vulnerability assessment, intrusion/ threat detection, digital investigations, mobile device management, log analysis, identity and access management, monitoring, endpoint security, security compliance and control and security advocacy.
* Project, task management, communication, and documentation skills
* Knowledge of a variety of security tools and technologies.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills.
* Ability to succeed in a team environment.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks.
* May perform other incidental tasks, as needed.
* All applicants must be eligible to work in the country where the internship is located.
* For internships in the US, students must pass a drug test prior to employment


We are looking for applicants who match ANY of the following:

* Working towards or already obtained a bachelor’s a degree with a concentration in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Cyber Security, or Information Technology.
* Preferable: Achieved one or more of the following certifications: IT Fundamentals, Network+, A+, Security+


Physical demands* Must be able to stand or sit for long periods of time


EEO and Disclosure:
*PRG is an Equal Opportunity Employer. PRG is a drug-free work environment, pre-employment testing will be required.*

 *This is a safety sensitive position and will require pre-employment drug screening.*

 *Production Resource Group LLC participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.*

 *PRG cares about the safety of our employees and applicants. PRG does not use chat rooms for job searches or communications. PRG will never request personal information via informal chat platforms or unsecure email. PRG will never ask for money or an exchange of money, banking or other personal information prior to an in-person interview. Be aware of potential scams while job seeking. title: Summer 2024 Intern - IT Compliance and Risk Analyst
description:
Company
Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas
We are dedicated to serving the public by promoting a strong financial system and a healthy economy for all. These efforts take a team of dedicated individuals doing many different jobs. Together we’re creating a workplace where talented people can thrive, and we welcome your unique background and perspective to help present the best possible solutions for our partners.  

  

Location: #LI-Hybrid
ABOUT THE DALLAS FED:
At the Dallas Fed we serve the public by partnering with communities and businesses, promoting jobs and stable prices, and keeping your money safe and available. We welcome different perspectives, ideas, and experiences, and are committed to maintaining an inclusive and diverse culture. As part of the nation’s central bank, we are committed to improving the economy and our communities. Are you ready to make a difference?
Learn more about the Dallas Fed: www.dallasfed.org/fed.
ABOUT THE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM:
We offer paid, full-time summer internships for many majors, with fulfilling work and opportunities to grow. To help launch your career, we provide dedicated staff mentors. You’ll also learn from senior leaders and industry experts. As part of the Federal Reserve System, you’ll be connected to a professional network that spans the nation. You will begin in early June and will be based in the Dallas office.
Learn more about our internship program: www.dallasfed.org/internships.
ABOUT YOUR TEAM:
Credit Risk Management (CRM) is a national business line within the Federal Reserve System (FRS) that plays a key role in the Federal Reserve's mission to support effective monetary policy and financial system stability. The CRM function is responsible for extending daylight and overnight credit to depository institutions through the Federal Reserve's discount window, mitigating payment system risks, monitoring banking conditions, and valuing collateral. To perform these functions, the CRM business line leverages a suite of automated technology tools and applications within the CRM IT portfolio.
The Dallas Fed has a dedicated IT team that supports the CRM IT portfolio. Overarching responsibilities include managing, operating, supporting, and developing the IT tools on behalf of the FRS CRM business line. This internship will primarily work with the CRM IT compliance & risk team, which is responsible for ensuring that the organization is in adherence to all applicable FRS, District, and CRM business line policies, procedures, and standards, including information security policies.
WHAT YOU’LL DO:* Support the CRM IT compliance & risk team with developing, governing and maintaining the compliance and risk management program for the organization.
* Support the CRM IT organization with its development and implementation of a new business continuity and disaster recovery strategy and associated procedures.
* Create and manage a central document repository for CRM IT policies, procedures, and guides.
* Work with the compliance team to develop risk management strategies to avoid non-compliance.
* Assist in coordinating the organization's security attestations across all applicable applications and platforms.
* Assist in coordinating compliance-related activities and audits.
* Bring your creativity and fresh perspective to the table through active engagements with the team and business-line stakeholders.


WHAT YOU BRING:* Degree/Major in Computing & Information Security; Business Management & Administration; Cybersecurity or other
* Undergraduate entering their Junior or Senior year; IT- or Business Administration-related degrees preferred but not required


OUR BENEFITS:* Flexible hours
* Professional development opportunities
* Broader networking opportunities across District
* Downtown location with free parking
* 24/7 on-site fitness center (Houston, Dallas)
* On-site café and coffee shop

Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. (40 hours/ week). Some additional hours may be required

title: Cyber Systems Security Engineer Intern - Dallas, TX
description:
**JOB ID:** 659181BR


**Date posted:** Jan. 04, 2024


**Program:** Dallas / IAMD / LT-P3 / PROD CONT


  

**Description:**

At Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control (MFC) you’ll have an opportunity to create a better world every day. For most individuals, our work challenges belong merely to headlines and tweets but our employees routinely experience a broad range of programs and projects, each geared to important human needs.
  

  

Whatever your assignment, you’ll use your education and experience to take on formidable challenges.  

Meanwhile, you can rely on the resources of a global technology leader to back the kind of  

innovation that has characterized our historic  

breakthroughs.  

  

MFC is seeking a Cyber Systems Security Engineering Intern for a position in Dallas, TX or Orlando, FL. The candidate will have the opportunity to be involved in some of Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control’s highly innovative and ingenious solutions to complex technical problems facing the aerospace industry.
  

  

You will leverage your technical, and interpersonal skills in a structured team framework and work in a cross-functional engineering Team environment. The candidate will conduct exploitation testing to improve integrity and security of weapon system environments at Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control. Candidate will perform penetration testing and related activities across a wide  

variety of platforms and technologies using  

advanced techniques and methodologies, such as embedded hardware, electronic warfare, radio frequency, etc.  

**Basic Qualifications:**

  

Actively working towards a Bachelor’s degree or higher in Electrical, Mechanical, Aerodynamics, Computer Engineering, Physics, or Mathematics.  

  

Ability to obtain a security clearance.  

**Desired Skills:**

  

Desired skills :  

* Ability to develop exploits, recommend fixes


and mitigation based on identified vulnerabilities  

* Ability to perform source code and


disassembled code reviews  

* Possess or have the ability to obtain a Level II


DoD Certification IAW DoD 8570.01-M within six months of assignment  

* Experience with scripting (Powershell/Kickstart/Ansible/Python)

**Security Clearance Statement:**

This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.  

**Clearance Level:**

Secret  

**Other Important Information You Should Know**

  

**Expression of Interest:**

By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.  

**Ability to Work Remotely:**

Part-time Remote Telework: The employee selected for this position will work part of their work schedule remotely and part of their work schedule at a designated Lockheed Martin facility. The specific weekly schedule will be discussed during the hiring process.  

**Work Schedules:**

Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.  

**Schedule for this Position:**

Part-Time as assigned by leader  

**Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.**  

**The application window will close in 90 days; applicants are encouraged to apply within 5 - 30 days of the requisition posting date in order to receive optimal consideration.**  

Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  

  

As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  

**Experience Level:**

Co-op/Summer Intern  

**Business Unit:**

MISSILES AND FIRE CONTROL  

**Relocation Available:**

Possible  

**Career Area:**

Systems Engineering: Other  

**Type:**

Call-In  

**Shift:**

First
  
At Lockheed Martin, we apply our passion for purposeful innovation to keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges.


**Mission-Focused Innovation:** From aerospace to outer space to cyber space, you can solve the world's most complex challenges for our customers.


**Foundational Values:** Our culture of performance excellence, ethics, teamwork and inclusion is embedded in everything we do.


**Diverse Career Opportunities with Meaningful Work:** Grow your career and skills for life. Our technology-driven learning platforms and programs enable your development and agility.


**Your Health, Your Wealth, Your Life:** Our flexible schedules, competitive pay and comprehensive benefits enable you to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work.


**Empowered to Be Your Best:** Use your strengths to make a difference in the lives of one another, our customers, our communities and our planet.


**Commitment to Sustainability:** We foster innovation, integrity and security to preserve the environment, strengthen diverse communities and propel growth.


Here, the possibilities are endless because we offer:


Flexible Schedules, dependent on role
Levels: Student, Entry, Mid, Senior, Management
Locations: Nationwide & OCONUS Positions

title: Enterprise Security Engineering Intern
description:
Hilltop Holdings is currently looking for a qualified student to join our Information Technology team as an Intern.The Enterprise Security Engineering Intern will engage with our senior technical security staff to implement and maintain technical security controls to ensure the security of Hilltop s information systems. The Security Engineering Intern will assist with identifying misconfigurations in technical controls that impact the security goals of deployed solutions. The Intern with work under the supervision of IT management responsible for our security tools and network related hardware and software solutions to gain insight into and an appreciation for processes and activities, specifically related to our security posture and controls. Identify root cause for recurring issues reported through our vulnerability management toolset, collaborate to design the remediation, and plan the implementation of the solution.


  
* Must be at least a junior currently enrolled in college pursuing a bachelor’s degree in: Computer Information Systems, Computer Engineer, Systems Engineer, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Management, or another similar major.
* Excellent verbal, written and communication skills
* Proven self-starter who can initiate tasks and follow up to completion
* Exceptional time management and organizational skills
* Exceptional analytical skills; above average attention to detail
* Desire to learn about career opportunities in the Information Technology area and/or financial services industry
* Excellent PC skills, including Microsoft Office Suite
* Candidate MUST have authorization to work for any employer in the US without requiring sponsorship, whether in student status or not

  
The intern will rotate through three specific functions within the IT organization (security engineering, project planning and user experience when interacting with enterprise security tools and solutions).


The intern will provide a presentation to articulate their assessment and work for each of the three functions. This will provide the intern with experience and visibility across three critical components of an IT organization’s charter and responsibilities (IT planning, security operational support and end user experience).


* Areas of focus will include:
	+ Email / Messaging Security
	+ Privileged Access Management
	+ Data Security
	+ Network Security & Traffic Analysis
	+ Endpoint Security
	+ SIEM & SOAR
	+ Vulnerability Management / WebApp Scanning
	+ Application Security
	+ Cryptography / PKI
	+ Securing Cloud Services
* Other duties as assigned

title: 2024 IT Security Operations Internship
description:
**More Than a Internship:**



Whitley Penn has become one of the region’s most distinguished accounting firms by providing exceptional service that reaches far beyond traditional accounting. The primary mission of Whitley Penn – from its inception to today – has been to provide an unmatched level of high quality service to our clients.



As an, **IT Security Operations Intern** you’ll be an integral member of the Whitley Penn IT team and provide firm wide support for information and data security. The IT Security Operations Intern will be responsible for:


* monitoring and reporting of systems and endpoints security events, incidents, and performance
* follow-up troubleshooting and remediation of possible incidents and findings
* implementation and maintenance of various security software, appliances, tools, and configurations across the enterprise as directed
* Reviewing and collecting data and analyzing existing and new security tools, systems, and operations and then research, recommend, plan, and remediate accordingly
* Executing regular data security activities and reporting as directed
* Collaborating with third-party support and service vendors to ensure optimal operational security with no disruption to client service or staff productivity
* Evaluating current security and asset protection procedures relative to passwords, file protection, system audit procedures, user accounts, software installations etc
* Providing third-level support to Helpdesk team and server administrators when needed


**About our Internship Program:**



Whitley Penn interns have the opportunity to learn, innovate and succeed while working collaboratively with all levels of leadership and management. Our internship program is designed to give you the opportunity to work in a collaborative setting and get a true experience of what the day to day responsibilities for Analyst level IT and Security professionals.



Our culture is centered on promoting a healthy work environment and we encourage our interns to grow in both their professional and personal development skills. Interns are provided a mentor throughout the entirety of their internship as they begin to build their brand in the workplace. Interns also go through our professional development program, called DEVELOP at WP.


**The goal of the DEVELOP program is to:**


* Provide opportunities to expand in your leadership skills
* Network with peers and cultivate working relationships
* Engage with firm leaders and develop professional skills


**You’re a fit for the 2024** **IT Security Operations Internship** **if you:**


* Have a working knowledge of network, data, and security technologies
* Are an effective communicator and can interact well with all levels of employees and clients.
* Are a team player with high performance standards and are looking to work under supervision and independently
* Take Initiative to manage job related continuing education, stay up to date on current trends in information security
* Are pursuing a degree in Information Technology or related field; or can demonstrate an understanding of or experience in information security specific positions and responsibility
* Have additional information security licenses or certifications, 1 or more years of experience in information security, computer science, or have experience in information technology related work in financial services, retail, or accounting – that’s a plus!


**Expected Graduation Date with:**


* December 2024
* May 2025
* December 2025

  


*Whitley Penn is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to on age, race, creed, gender, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. Whitley Penn is a participant in E-Verify please follow the link to review disclosure notifications:* *https://www.dropbox.com/s/olsr5xgsgxsntu3/E-Verify%20Notices.pdf?dl=0**. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.*

#### **Education**


Preferred* Bachelors or better in Computer Science
* Bachelors or better in Information Technology
* Associates or better in Computer Science
* Associates or better in Information Technology

#### **Behaviors**


Preferred* Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity
* Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
* Innovative: Consistently introduces new ideas and demonstrates original thinking
* Detail Oriented: Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well

#### **Motivations**


Preferred* Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization
* Work-Life Balance: Inspired to perform well by having ample time to pursue work and interests outside of work
* Growth Opportunities: Inspired to perform well by the chance to take on more responsibility
* Entrepreneurial Spirit: Inspired to perform well by an ability to drive new ventures within the business


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Summer 2024 IT Intern - Cyber Security
description:
**D.R. Horton, Inc., the largest homebuilder in the U.S.,** was founded in 1978 and is a publicly traded company on the New York Stock Exchange. It is engaged in the construction and sale of high quality homes designed principally for the entry-level and first time move-up markets. The Company also provides mortgage financing and title services for homebuyers through its mortgage and title subsidiaries. Please visit our website at www.drhorton.com for more information.

  

  

**D.R. Horton, Inc.** is currently looking for an **IT Intern**. The right candidate will assist the IT Managers and IT Team with the management of all IT functions. Learn the different aspects of the IT department and the methods within the company, support company policies, suggest improvements within the system and execute policies to ensure compliance with quality standards.


The intern will also be encouraged to explore other areas of interest to learn more about the general operations of the division both within and outside of the assigned department that will be supplemental to the learning experience.

  


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities** include the following. Other duties may be assigned.


* Conducts all business in a professional and ethical manner to serve customers and increase the goodwill and profit of the company
* Ability to work overtime
* Ability to travel overnight
  


**Qualifications**  

**Education and/or Experience**


* Must currently be enrolled in an accredited 4-year college or university and seeking a bachelor’s degree in a related field
* Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written oral form or via DRH applications
* Proficiency with MS Office and email
* Ability to sit for majority of 8-hour workday; use hands and fingers to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and peripheral vision
* The noise level is generally moderate

  




Come join a winning team with a Fortune 500 company! We are growing fast and are looking for enthusiastic attitudes and team players to join our success.

  


***Build YOUR future with D.R. Horton, America’s Builder.*** ***#WeBuildPeople2***

title: Summer Intern
description:
**Join TriumphX!**

TriumphX provides a concentration of technology and project management resources the members of the Triumph Financial portfolio of brands – TriumphPay, Triumph and TBK Bank – via a shared service model. We’re looking for top tech and project management talent to analyze, recommend and build strategic solutions that support Triumph Financial’s mission to become a world-class, market-leading financial and technology company.

At Triumph Financial, we are a purpose-driven financial services company focused on creating value by helping our team members thrive, our customers succeed, and our communities prosper. When we do this, we are “Helping People Triumph.”

Our paid internship program enables students to participate in valuable real-world experience through a variety of tailored assignments within their areas of interest and fields of study. Students will also be given an opportunity to partner with other interns to explore other areas of the organization and learn from a diverse group of Executive Leaders throughout the program. Learning opportunities will be provided throughout the summer to equip you with essential skills you can take with you to apply throughout your career.

**Opportunity**

Currently, we have the following internships available:

* IT > Project Management
* IT > Information Security
* IT> Data analyst or Data Engineer

***This is a 9-week program running from June 10, 2024 – August 9, 2024.***

**Responsibilities**

As an intern, you will….

* If chosen for the project management route help determine the capacity of our infrastructure allow us to determine the demand that our system can handle today so we can focus on improvements for the future.
* If chosen for the information security route work on scripting automation processes to handle data from our different applications in a secure manner.
* Regardless of route you will be responsible for working well along side our current team members and learning as much as you can from them.
* Make the most of the career development events you will participate in this summer.

***​***

**Position Qualifications**

* 1--2 years of relevant work experience
* Currently pursuing a bachelor’s or master’s degree in one of the following degree programs: Computer science, cyber security, management information systems, information security or another related field.
* You are graduating from an under grad or graduate program between Dec 2024 and Aug 2025
* Must be willing to work at our onsite company headquarters (Dallas, Texas) full-time.
* Strong technical, logical, analytical, and critical thinking skills
* High levels of commitment and initiative
* Proficient in Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Access, and Outlook

**Physical Requirements**

* Must be able to perform essential duties satisfactorily with reasonable accommodations.
* Work is generally done sitting, talking, hearing, and typing. Visual acuity to use a keyboard, prepare and analyze data and figures; transcribing, viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading.

​

**Work Environment**

* Work is regularly performed in a combination of office and conference settings and routinely uses standard office equipment.
* Travel Required: Occasional 0-10% to local offices in the DFW area.

**Compensation** 

* $21 per hour

#LI-KF1

**We offer Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid Time Off, 401k and much more.**

Go on. Do it. Apply Today!

title: Azure Cloud Developer Intern: Immediate Opening
description:
**Azure Cloud Developer Internship at Applied Concepts**

*Immediate Opening*

*Richardson, TX*

  
**Azure Cloud Developer Intern - Job Overview:** 

Applied Concepts has been known for its exceptional law enforcement Radar & Lidar systems for over 47 years. We're based in Richardson, TX, less than 3 miles from the UTD campus. We're taking big steps to transition over to cloud-based platforms and our team is looking for motivated Azure Cloud Developer interns to join us for Spring 2023 and beyond. 

We are looking for one part-time intern (with flexible start dates); hours per week will be project-based but are negotiable in advance. This internship requires occasional availability for scheduled onsite meetings, but this is mostly a work-from-home position. 

***The compensation for this internship is $20-$30 per hour, based on skill set and education level. (No relocation assistance is possible for out-of-area candidates).*** 

  
**Azure Cloud Developer Intern - How You'll Make an Impact:**

As an Azure Cloud Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, prototyping, and testing cloud-based solutions using Microsoft Azure services and technologies. You will also collaborate with other developers, architects, and stakeholders to ensure that the solutions meet business requirements and adhere to the best practices and standards. 

  
**Azure Cloud Developer Intern - Qualifications:**

* A bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, data science, or related field.
* Familiar with common learning-based algorithms, such as classification, clustering, DNN, embedding, multi-task learning, and reinforcement learning.
* Proficient in at least one programming language, such as C# & Python.
* Proficiency in SQL (MySQL or MS SQL) & Java, JavaScript.
* Knowledge of cloud security, performance, scalability, and reliability principles and practices.
* Good problem-solving, and teamwork skills.

***Added bonus if you have:***

* Experience in C/C++, JavaScript and Java.
* Experience in .NET Core, ASP.NET Core, RESTful APIs.
* Familiarity with Azure DevOps, Git, CI/CD pipelines, and testing tools.
* Exposure to big data concepts (Hadoop, Pyspark)
* Experience in machine learning, data mining, information retrieval, statistics, or natural language processing

  
**Azure Cloud Developer Intern -** **What you'll be doing:**

* Collaborate with Data Management Teams: Work closely with Enterprise Data Management teams to stay informed about policy changes, and actively implement necessary adjustments in our data ecosystem to meet data risk and legal requirements.
* Build and Sustain High-Performing Teams: Establish and maintain a robust, high-performing team, cultivating a supportive culture that consistently upholds excellence in performance.
* Drive Innovation and Adaptability: Exhibit innovation and creativity, eagerly exploring new ideas and adapting swiftly to changes, ensuring the team stays at the forefront of industry advancements.

  
**Azure Cloud Developer Intern -** **What You'll Gain:**

* Career-building project experience.
* Competitive compensation.
* Rewards and recognition programs.
* Learning and development opportunities.
* Code reviews and mentoring from industry experts.
* Convenient office location.
* Excellent work/life balance.
* Great culture and collaborative environment.

  
**Who We Are:**

Applied Concepts is a 47-year-old, 200-person privately owned company, located in Richardson, Texas. Founded in 1977 by an electrical engineer, we have a long history of profitable, organic growth. Our company remains entrepreneurial at heart, constantly re-inventing ourselves with new products and new markets, but still balanced with business prudence. We manufacture our own products, in our own facilities. Integrating our product development with our own manufacturing resources is a key part of our business culture, keeping us nimble and able to provide high quality products.

  
**What We Do:**

We focus on designing, manufacturing, and selling products that promote public safety. We are the number one supplier of speed enforcement products to law enforcement in the United States. Our employees take pride in the quality of our products and the service we provide in keeping our streets and neighborhoods safe. We offer a variety of engineering challenges, from microwave to high-speed lasers, to image capturing and processing, and LED traffic calming devices. 

  
**To learn more about us and explore career opportunities, please visit www.stalkerradar.com**

  
*Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.* *We use E-Verify to confirm eligibility for all new hires.*

title: Cybersecurity Intern
description:
MRC Global serves the oil and gas industry across the upstream, midstream and downstream sectors as well as the chemical and gas distribution market sectors worldwide.
Key Duties & Responsibilities *–*
The IT Cybersecurity Intern will work closely with our experienced cybersecurity professionals to gain practical knowledge and hands-on experience in various aspects of information security. This internship provides an excellent opportunity to learn and contribute to real-world cybersecurity initiatives.
The Job Title’s responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Preferred Experience* Enrolled in an accredited program pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field with upper-level coursework in your degree plan.
* Basic understanding of networking, operating systems, and security concepts.
* Familiarity with common security tools and technologies like SIEM and Defender agents.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
* Passion for cybersecurity and a desire to learn and grow in this field.


Skills & Abilities & Responsibilities* Assist in monitoring network traffic for potential vulnerabilities.
* Analyze security logs and identify anomalous activities.
* Identify weaknesses in our systems and processes.
* Collaborate with the team to develop and implement security policies and protocols.
* Support incident response efforts during security incidents.
* Participate in security awareness training and education programs.
* Assist in maintaining and updating security documentation.
* Contribute to risk assessments and vulnerability assessments.
* Stay informed about emerging threats and security best practices.


Duration:
This is a paid internship with a flexible duration, typically lasting for a summer.
Location:
MRC Global’s main office is located in Downtown Houston and will require the intern to be in the office 3 days a week minimum.
Application Process:
Interested candidates should submit their resume and a brief cover letter explaining their interest in cybersecurity and relevant coursework.
Working Conditions* Work is performed in an office environment.
* May require prolonged periods of sitting/standing


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.
California Employee Data Collection Notice

title: IS Intern - Risk and Compliance
description:
Job Type:


Intern/Student (Fixed Term)
Plains All American (PAA) is an industry-leading transportation and midstream provider specializing in transportation, storage, processing and marketing solutions for crude oil and natural gas liquids (NGLs). We own an extensive network of pipeline transportation, terminalling, storage and gathering assets in key crude oil and NGL producing basins and transportation corridors and at major market hubs in the United States and Canada. On average, PAA handles more than 6 million barrels per day of crude oil and NGL in its Transportation segment. The company is headquartered in Houston, Texas.


We are looking for highly-motivated students who enjoy working as part of a team in a dynamic and entrepreneurial work environment and have a strong interest in a career in the energy industry.


The Plains Intern program offers interns the opportunity to learn and develop the skills they need to pursue long, successful careers in the energy industry.


Interns are an integral part of our team, whose contributions help drive our business forward. Plains is proud to foster a culture where interns are empowered to ask questions and feel as though they are part of the team from day one. We provide our interns with opportunities to build their professional networks through working alongside skilled professionals, mentors, and other students.

  

Plains’ Intern program is an opportunity to get hands-on experience and education aligned with each student’s degree in the oil and gas midstream sector. Plains’ intern opportunities have been specifically designed to provide students with the opportunity to apply their academic studies and gain valuable experience through meaningful and challenging work. Plains offers one of the industry’s best formal training programs in which high achieving participants may become eligible to receive an offer to join Plains upon graduation.

 **IS** **Intern** **– Risk and Compliance**

  

We are seeking a Risk and Compliance Intern to join our IS (Information Services) team at Plains for a 13-week internship position beginning May 20, 2024. The Intern, Risk and Compliance will actively support enterprise risk analysis, auditing, and risk mitigation follow-up to ensure expected compliance with executive management expectations across Plains. This role will include work directly related to compliance with standards and regulations such as SOX, NIST, TSA, DHS, DOE, CCPA, and Data Privacy. Additionally, this role will work closely with various Internal and External audit teams and is expected to directly support audits where feasible to reduce the need for outside resources.

  

This position will assist the Manager of Risk and Compliance in preparing meaningful reports, metrics and implements, and other information essential to senior management and insight regarding the effectiveness of Plains’ IS cyber security platform.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Perform monthly SOX audit testing
* Perform cybersecurity Internal Audit test work over business IT and Operational Technology (OT) networks
* Assist SOX ITGC documentation gathering
* Perform SOX ITGC walkthroughs and process mapping and documentation/narratives
* Capture metrics used in Risk and Compliance reporting
* Collaborate with various security functions to support recurring Governance, Risk, and Compliance tasks
 **Qualifications:**

* Interns must be pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business Administration, or another related field
* Previous internship/work experience is preferred
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written)
* Desire to perform research and simplify complex security regulatory topics
* Self-motivated, eager learner, and aptitude to grow and develop
* Motivated to work in a team-based atmosphere
* Broad, basic knowledge of cyber security topics
* Healthy interest in learning about Security Governance, Risk, and Compliance
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and SharePoint
* Comfortable with virtual collaboration and meeting software, including Teams
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
* Ability to adapt and demonstrate flexibility in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to work independently
* Interns must be able and willing to relocate themselves to Houston for the duration of the work term
* Interns must be able to commit to a 13-week work term starting **May 20,** **2024** to be considered for the program
* Successful candidate must provide satisfactory references, complete a Criminal Background Check, and be in compliance with the Company’s Drug & Alcohol Policy including pre-employment testing.
 **Documents to include in when submitting** **your application:**

* Resume
* Copy of your unofficial transcript (you must include this in order to be considered)
 **Interested candidates are encouraged to** **submit** **their application through our company website (note you will not be considered if you apply through your university’s job board). All applications should be** **submitted** **on/or before February** **29****, 2024****.**

  

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


For our summer internship program, we look for sophomores, juniors, or seniors, working toward a bachelor's degree with solid academic credentials along with significant extracurricular involvement. Strong written and verbal communications skills are key to our business as well as having strong attention to detail. Students must demonstrate effective planning and organizational skills, proficiency with Microsoft products (MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint), and a strong desire to learn more about the Oil and Gas business.


Salary details estimated by job boards such as Indeed, Glassdoor, and LinkedIn do not represent Plains’ compensation structure. We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


By submitting your resume, you consent to the collection, use and necessary disclosure of the personal information provided during the application and selection process. Learn more.

title: Cybersecurity Intern
description:
First Community Credit Union is offering an eleven-week, full-time paid internship opportunity starting 5/22/23 and ending 8/4/23. based in Houston, TX for an individual looking to pursue a career in Information Technology (IT). This position will provide hands-on experience in a full range of IT related tasks and systems.



This individual will assist our Information Security Technology program with responsibilities that will include working to develop our security awareness program, implementation of security controls across our cloud and on-premise solutions, and responding to customer security inquiries. As your knowledge and experience expand, you will have opportunities to collaborate with our internal team members on our implementation of training, well-defined best practices, and creating technical content. You'll also be able to analyze existing capabilities and determine their effectiveness through testing, and provide solutions for improvement.


**Requirements:**



Must be pursuing a Bachelor's or graduate level degree in an Information Technology or computer related field.


**Desirable Traits:**


* Examine cybersecurity from a holistic view
* Understand the architecture, administration, management and the security issues of operating systems, networking and virtualization software
* High level of organization
* Ability to follow-up and complete duties in a timely manner
* High level of accuracy


**About Us****:**



FCCU has been in the community for 70 years, originally serving employees of the Spring Branch Independent School District. FCCU has recently expanded membership to include the Dallas/Fort Worth area, thereafter expanding our field of membership to 25 counties in the state of Texas. From our small beginnings to our current $2+ billion in assets, we have always operated under the philosophy of **"people-helping-people."** First Community Credit Union continues to lead the way as a high-tech, high-touch credit union with leading digital services including Online Banking, Mobile Banking, iPhone/Android Apps and more. FCCU also works to ensure our members are backed by the latest in security, launching products including EMV chip cards and My Money Maps. As a full-service financial institution, First Community Credit Union proudly serves the daily financial needs of over 147,000 members at our 17 locations. **Wouldn’t you like to be a part of our growing team?**


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Security Architect Intern
description:
**General Information:**


Hitachi Energy is seeking for Security Architect Intern for its TX, Houston location.

**Your Responsibilities:**

* Monitor resources in MS Azure and report issues.
* Modify, update and move certificates from one provider to another.
* Validate DNS changes and run scripts to effect these changes if required.
* Assist in the migration or deployment of resources to Azure tenant
* Assist with documenting security processes and procedures.
* Participate in product threat analysis and mitigation.
* Living Hitachi Energy’s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.

**Your Background:*** Educational focus on computer science, computer engineering, information sciences, information technology, or engineering field with specialization in cyber security.
* Interest in gaining practical real-world experience as part of a SaaS team to include working knowledge of cloud computing technologies and workload transition challenges from a Cyber Security perspective.
* Creativity to find innovative and realistic solutions to complex challenges, and an eagerness to learn about new technologies and to devise tools or tricks to get the job done.
* Strong problem solving & troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
* Excellent communication and technical writing skills (in English) to explain and document your ideas/plans and present them effectively to team members.
* Currently enrolled in an accredited university program in the US.
* Must be currently authorized to work for Hitachi Energy in the US.

title: 2024 Summer Internship - Human Resources Information Mastery: Advancing Security and Operational Efficiency
description:
Overview:
*Southeastern Grocers is committed to a culture of belonging and fostering an inclusive environment where we celebrate differences. As a* *great place to work**, we empower everyone to be their full, authentic selves. Read our* *Belonging, Inclusion and Diversity Statement here**.* **2024 Summer Internships at Southeastern Grocers** **Southeastern Grocers is looking for highly motivated, organized and creative interns for our exciting 2024 summer program at our Jacksonville Store Support Center!**  

Our interns will have the opportunity to **learn**, **grow** and **contribute** to our **people-first** grocery retail business. Our summer interns work with leaders from across our organization to plan and execute project that will directly contribute to the success and growth of SEG! Our program offers personal and professional development opportunities, leadership networking and the opportunity to build life-long friendships with fellow career-minded interns.  

SEG is proud to be certified as a Great Place to Work and we’re looking for motivated self-starters committed to excellence and driven to provide great customer service.

Our 2024 program includes projects from across the business, including teams like:* Asset Protection
* Marketing
* Human Resources

Our Talent Acquisition team will follow up with the next steps in the process.  

We appreciate your interest in a summer internship opportunity at Southeastern Grocers!

title: IT Summer 2024 Internship - Graduate
description:
**Florida Blue is seeking 2024 summer IT interns**



The IT Summer Internship program is focused on providing college juniors, seniors, and graduate students exposure into Florida Blue’s business processes and the IT systems that support them. Interns will gain hands on experience working on relative projects and initiatives that support our IT organization. In addition, interns will have on the job training and partner with a mentor and leader in the IT field specific to their assigned track.


**Follow us on Twitter @FLBlue and #WorkWellHere!**



Applicants will have the opportunity to choose from one of the 10 offered tracks:


**Generative AI:**  

Interns in the Generative AI track will have the unique opportunity to gain hands on experience with developing, fine-tuning, evaluating, and deploying generative AI models to help solve complex business problems at GuideWell. Interns will work closely with business and IT stakeholders to communicate AI capabilities and integrate solutions into our organization’s workflow to drive efficiency and innovation. Candidates should have skillsets acquired through coursework or experience such as natural language processing (NLP), proficiency in programming languages such as Python with relevant frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch, knowledge of machine learning and deep learning fundamentals, data manipulation, and statistical analysis as well as a strong interest in generative AI.


**Infrastructure:**  

Interns will focus on monitoring, installation, configuration, debugging, administration, troubleshooting, and maintenance of technology solutions. Interns will also be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining policies, procedures, and programs to ensure the security and integrity of company data, databases, information systems, and technology. To be successful in this role, the intern should demonstrate proficiency and experience in design, implementation, monitoring and/or troubleshooting technology.


**Cloud Services:**  

Interns will research, design, and support Cloud Services. Areas of focus will include infrastructure as code, networking, automation, data storage, and security using Amazon Web Services and/or Microsoft Azure. To be successful in this role, the intern should be a self-started with a willingness to learn.


**Front End Development and Innovation:**  

Interns will focus on creating new innovative designs, front-end prototype applications and exploring new technology and development capabilities for Florida Blue. They will need to leverage their skills learned through college courses, personal experiences, and creative outlets to design solutions that bring value to the business. To be successful in this role, the intern should be creative and up to date on current technology trends. Experience with basic web development and design and/or any other general programming such as Python or Swift is highly preferred.


**Cybersecurity:**  

Interns will work with one of the top cybersecurity organizations in the country and be given the opportunity to work with highly skilled red-team and blue-team members on real-world issues and projects. In addition, interns will gain exposure into multiple security frameworks and an accelerated integrated risk management program. Interns should show a willingness to learn and to increase their understanding of information security concepts, principles, and solutions.  

  

**Application Development:**  

Interns will focus on the development of new applications with basic programming knowledge of JavaScript/HTML/CSS or other Object-Oriented programming experience and database concepts. Interns should have excellent written and verbal communication skills to aid them in the development of applications and the requirements gathering process. Interns will be expected to leverage their skills learned through college courses, personal experiences, and creative outlets to design solutions that bring value to the business. To be successful in this role, the intern should be creative, team-oriented, and up to date on current technology trends.  

  

**Data Science/Analytics:**  

Interns will work on real business problems and with publicly available datasets. Interns will focus on learning and applying Data Science techniques such as Data Wrangling, Model development and Visualization. Interns must have basic level skills in SQL, R and/or Python to be used over the course of the program. Additionally, interns will be focused on data analytics, business intelligence and data quality assessment for Florida Blue. The intern should be passionate and inquisitive, a quick learner, and an expert “Googler”.


**Behavioral Sciences:**  

Interns will work with senior members of the team to leverage data and behavioral science insights to improve the well-being of our members, address specific business issues, and formulate insight-based recommendations linked to strategic and financial outcomes. Interns will contribute to literature review, data analysis, experimental design (A/B testing), survey design, creation and implementation of recommendations. A successful candidate should have a background or coursework in psychology/decision science/behavioral economics/data science and demonstrate a positive, innovative, open mindset and a desire to collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams. Candidates should be proficient in Excel and PowerPoint, and knowledge of R or Python is a plus.


**Project Analyst:**  

Interns will work with senior-level team members in the role of Project Analyst. The focus will be on learning the ‘soft skills’ required in communication, meeting management, prioritizing and organizing work, and emotional intelligence. In addition, they’ll experience basic elements of planning techniques using both Waterfall and Agile methodologies. Interns will be exposed to tools used in Project Management, real-world issues and risks, various types of meetings (planning, problem-solving, Agile events), and the financial aspects of budgeting for projects. A successful candidate will be familiar with the fundamentals of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Project Management as defined in the PMBOK (Project Management Body of Knowledge), and the Agile methodology. Willingness to learn, ask questions, and keep an open mind are essential.


**Business System Analyst:**  

Interns will work with business partners to define and document detailed business requirements, collaborate with software developers, product owners, and testers to support an end-to-end capability from concept to production-deployment. They will offer post-production support, respond to business and end user inquiries, and troubleshoot to determine root cause for application defects. Interns will enable stakeholders to make effective decisions by gathering information from multiple sources and compiling it into an actionable format and successfully communicating that information.



In addition to their day-to-day responsibilities, interns will have exposure to our IT Command Center and World Class Data Center, as well as meet with leaders from Information Security, Data Analytics, Behavioral Science, and our Software Development teams. Interns will meet with Executive IT Leadership throughout the program, as well as present to various IT Vice Presidents at the program’s conclusion.



The IT Summer Internship also serves as a bridge to full time employment for interns who will have completed their bachelor’s degree or who are enrolled in a master’s degree at the conclusion of the program. Additionally, interns who are still completing their degree programs will have the opportunity to remain on with the company in a part-time role All interns whose talents align with the current and future needs of Florida Blue will be eligible and considered for employment opportunities.



We pride ourselves on a culture that embraces flexibility, innovation, and diversity. Please bring your unique talents and help us advance our mission of helping people and communities achieve better health.


**Must Have’s:**  

* Currently enrolled in computer science, information technology, mathematics, psychology, or related degree program Pursuing a Master's Degree
* Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or better
* Must be able to commit to working at least 30 hours a week
* Basic PC skills required including working knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook)
* Basic programming knowledge, JavaScript/HTML/CSS or other Object Oriented programming experience
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills; team and collaboration-oriented
* Work under minimal supervision and adapt to a dynamic, changing environment
* Must be a creative and innovative thinker

**What We Offer:**  

As a Florida Blue employee, you will thrive in our Be Well, Work Well, GuideWell culture where being well as an individual, and working well as a team, are both important in serving our members and communities.



To support your wellbeing, comprehensive benefits are offered. As an employee, you will have access to:



Medical, dental, vision, life and global travel health insurance;  

Income protection benefits: life insurance, Short- and long-term disability programs;  

Leave programs to support personal circumstances;  

Retirement Savings Plan includes employer contribution and employer match;  

Paid time off, volunteer time off, and 11 holidays  

Additional voluntary benefits available; and  

A comprehensive wellness program

  

Employee benefits are designed to align with federal and state employment laws. Benefits may vary based on the state in which work is performed. Benefits for intern, part-time and seasonal employees may differ.



To support your financial wellbeing, we offer competitive pay as well as opportunities for incentive or commission compensation. We also conduct regular annual reviews with pay for performance considerations for base pay increases.


**Typical Hourly Pay Range: $22 - $32**



Final pay will be determined with consideration of market competitiveness, internal equity, and the job-related knowledge, skills, training, and experience you bring.



We are an Equal Opportunity/Protected Veteran/Disabled Employer committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable culture for our employees and communities.

Student Affairs Graduate Intern
description:
Are you seeking to gain real-world experience in higher education administration specifically in the field of career development? We invite you to join our team as a Student Affairs Graduate Intern at SUNY College of Optometry. This internship will primarily be working with the Career Development Center as well as our CSTEP (Collegiate Science and Technology Entry Program) program; however, there will also be opportunities to delve into operations of other various key departments within Student Affairs, including Financial Aid, Registrar, Admissions, Opportunity Programs, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and direct collaboration with the Vice President for Student Affairs & Engagement.   
  
**Key Responsibilities:**  
As an intern within the Office of Student Affairs at the SUNY College of Optometry, you will play a vital role in supporting the overall operations of our institution specifically our Career Development Center and CSTEP program. Interns will gain hands-on experience within various facets of Student Affairs, receive mentorship and guidance from experienced professionals, and develop a deeper understanding of the operations of a health professions school.  
  
**Qualifications:*** Enrolled as a student in an MA program in Higher Education.
* Strong organizational and communication skills
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
* Interest in higher education and student affairs.

  
Salary Range: $20-25/hour range/10 hours per week.   
  
Click here to apply: **https://sunyopt.peopleadmin.com/postings/2042**  
  
The State University of New York, College of Optometry, is an Affirmative Action/Equal Employment Opportunity/Americans with Disabilities Act employer. The College actively seeks applications from women, veterans, individuals with disability, members of underrepresented groups, or anyone that would enrich the diversity of the College.  
  
Pursuant to Executive Order 161, no State entity, as defined by the Executive Order, is permitted to ask, or mandate, in any form, that an applicant for employment provide his or her current compensation, or any prior compensation history, until such time as the applicant is extended a conditional offer of employment with compensation. If such information has been requested from you before such time, please contact the Office of Employee Relations at (518) 474-6988 or via email at **info@oer.ny.gov****.**  
*To view the College’s Annual Security Report, visit* ***https://sunyopt.edu/?s=annual+security+report***  
  
**About SUNY College of Optometry:**The State University of New York College of Optometry advances visual health and patient care through leadership in education, research and service.More than a half century ago a group of dedicated optometrists and benefactors came together to create an institution that would support optometric education, vision science research and extend quality vision care to all New Yorkers and the surrounding community. The State University of New York College of Optometry evolved from this mission.Since we opened our doors to our first class of students in 1971, the College has grown to become one of the leading optometric education and vision research centers in the world. The College houses the University Eye Center — one of the largest outpatient vision care clinics in the country—and engages in cutting edge research that is helping to shape the future of optometric care.

title: On-Site Marketing Intern
description:
POSITION SUMMARY 

\*\*\*This is a part-time internship position. The pay rate is $16/hour with 10-20 hours of work expected each week through September.

The part-time seasonal marketing intern will support and report to the SummerStage On-Site Marketing Assistants (one manager citywide and one manager in Central Park) in a broad range of marketing outreach activities at SummerStage. 

This role is an opportunity to work on diverse projects with massive New York City exposure. This position requires live event and production experience with a proactive and can-do attitude, strong attention to detail, organizational skills, problem-solving proficiency, and the ability to work outside on nights and weekends.

**COMPENSATION**: $**16/hour**RESPONSIBILITIES 

* Attend a selection of SummerStage concert performances (estimated 2-4 events/week with variance) between June - October in Central Park and in citywide parks throughout the five boroughs.
* Act as the primary brand ambassador representative for the Marketing / Information booth including assisting with booth set up, communicating event details and answering questions for all attendees, encouraging attendees to complete the SummerStage survey and sign up for SummerStage e-newsletters, providing assistance to the SummerStage membership and production teams, and distributing marketing materials.
* Assist with SummerStage social media plan on-site, including posting live updates on X (formerly Twitter), Instagram, Facebook, and TikTok.
* Assist press on-site with check-in, credentials, VIP check-in access and press interviews when needed in addition to coordinating with operations and security team management of the press photo pit.
* Additional on-site assistance as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS * 1+ years experience in live events, production, marketing or related field, OR a passion to learn in the field
* Excellent oral communication skills
* Outgoing and personable attitude
* Familiar with social media tools such as Facebook, X (formerly Twitter), Instagram, YouTube, TikTok
* Comfortable being our social media ambassador and appearing on our social channels (TikTok videos, Instagram stories, etc.)
* Highly organized, strong attention to detail, and the ability to handle multiple projects at once
* Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment and problem solve quickly
* Ability to prioritize and to work independently and proactively on a team
* Must be available to work evenings and weekends and travel independently across the five boroughs
* Bi- or multi-lingual a plus

ABOUT CITY PARKS FOUNDATION 

At City Parks Foundation (CPF), we are dedicated to invigorating and transforming New York City parks into dynamic, vibrant centers of urban life through arts, environmental education, sports, and community building programs for all New Yorkers. Our ethos is simple: we believe thriving parks mean thriving communities. 

Community engagement includes Partnerships for Parks, a public-private program of City Parks Foundation and NYC Parks, which supports and champions a growing network of community leaders who care and advocate for the transformation of our neighborhood parks and the Parks and Open Space Partners-NYC coalition of conservancies and alliances. We also administer the NYC Green Fund, a regranting program for parks and open space nonprofits and grassroots organizations.

We produce SummerStage, the iconic free, outdoor performing arts festival in NYC, presenting world-class artists from across the globe and our own neighborhoods on our mainstage in Central Park and in local parks in all five boroughs, and our Swedish Cottage Marionette Theatre and roving PuppetMobile present marionette puppet theater throughout New York City. 

We connect youngsters to nature in the urban environment through progressive, experiential teaching. Using parks as classrooms, we provide learning experiences and hands-on activities in urban forests, coastal areas, and gardens. 

Free golf, tennis, track & field, soccer, and fitness programs bring high-quality instruction and equipment into areas where few organized athletic opportunities exist. We offer leveled training, year-round scholarship coaching, and special pro events.

title: Pharmacy Technician/Intern
description:
**Job Summary**

* Prepares medications under the direction of a pharmacist and assists with related job duties.

 

**General Accountabilities**

* Receives and verifies written prescriptions or refill requests for accuracy.
* Mixes pharmaceutical preparations according to written prescriptions.
* Maintains proper storage and ensures necessary security of drugs.
* Establishes and maintains patient profiles.
* Answers telephones to discuss or answer patient requests or questions.
* Assists patients at the pharmacy by answering simple questions, locating items or referring them to the pharmacist for medication information.
* Prices and then files prescriptions that have been filled.
* Receives and stores incoming drug or other related pharmacy supplies.
* Verifies invoices and physical quantities received of incoming items.
* Monitors medications in the pharmaceutical inventory to keep in stock medications current and disposes of outdated medications.
* Works with buyer or purchasing agent to keep medications in stock to acceptable levels.
* \*The company reserves the right to add or change duties at any time.

 

**Job Qualifications**

* Education: High school diploma or equivalent
* Experience: 3-5 years of related experience or vocational training, PTCB preferred. Proficiency in Micromerchant Systems (Prime RX) is required.
* Bilingual preferred. Spanish, Hindi, and/or Punjabi.

 

**Skills**

* Excellent verbal and written communication
* Critical thinking
* Monitoring
* Service orientation
* Time management

title: Information Technology Intern
description:
K2 Integrity is looking for a paid intern to join our team in New York for the summer. This intern will have the opportunity to work closely with IT professionals, gaining exposure to network projects, firewall/switch configuration and maintenance, and system monitoring deployment. The ideal candidate for this role will be a student in their final semester, majoring in cyber security or information systems, with a GPA of 3.5 or higher.

* Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills.

K2 Integrity helps clients understand and manage risk so they can lead with confidence in a complex world—and build organizations that are safer, more transparent, and more resilient. By encouraging and enabling organizations to act with integrity, we can increase trust in institutions and promote prosperity and growth throughout the world.  
   
K2 Integrity has realized this promise in its role as the preeminent risk, compliance, investigations, and monitoring firm—built by industry leaders, driven by interdisciplinary teams, and supported by cutting-edge technology to safeguard clients’ operations, reputations, and economic security.
